Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2012 06:31PM - edited Apr 16, 2012 06:32PM by NevadaPaula I had fluid leak after my drains were pulled also. The bleeding went on for 1 1/2 days then stopped. I put gauze on it with tape. The first day I changed the gauze 3 times in one hour, then it gradually tappered out. No showers for me either until it stopped.
Posts.Title: oozing/bleeding from drain site? lea321 lea321

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2013 06:52AM NevadaPaula wrote: Thank you Beesie. That was never explained to me. My surgeon hinted that because it was in the outer quadrant, it would be harder to find. She said that my weight 180 lbs, was another factor.
Posts.Title: not finding the sentinel node NevadaPaula NevadaPaula

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2012 05:52PM NevadaPaula wrote: I had a small tattoo placed over my port scar. A single orange blossom vine, with blossoms and petals falling. A small bluegreen hummimgbird is hovering above the vine.  The tatoo hurt, it bled a little. But one year later it still looks good. Seeing that every day, gives my spirit a boost.
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2012 04:27PM - edited Sep 16, 2012 04:29PM by NevadaPaula The doctors put ports in the opposite side of the body. I had breast cancer in my left breast. Port was placed on my right side, an inch or so below the collarbone, with the tube going into the jugular. No risk of lymphadema for the tatoo. Use a licenced tattoo artist.
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: NevadaPaula wrote: 3 years ago I had breast cancer. My surgeon couldn't  find the sentinal node. I had 20 nodes taken out from my armpit, axillary lymph node dissection. I am obese as well. How common is this to happen? Dx 4/1/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, 0/20 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 4/1/2010 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary Log in to post a reply
